channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14724] Per column family numops metrics
item.description: It will be nice to have per CF regionserver metrics for number of operations i.e. per CF get, mutate, delete and scan numops.

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: Lets not try and do per cf for the whole regionserver. lets do per region per cf. Otherwise the contention starts to add up.

-1

So we've tried this strings based approach for column family metrics before. It leads to SERIOUSLY bad perf. We should follow the lead of per region metrics and have something attached to store.
That will allow updating the metrics without any string gc issues.

V1:
Attaching counters to stores is difficult as the context of each operation is not available at Store level. However, I have followed the approach similar to what is already being done for the rest of region metrics i.e. storing per CF counters in the region. The is a counter for all CFs too, which is updated rather than iterating through all CFs, if a request operates on all the CFs for the table.

One interesting thing to note apart from the usual code review here is that the name UNKNOWN is used as a column family for reporting metrics when batchMutate operations have inconsistent set of CFs.

Any thoughts, guys? Here is the link to the review board:
https://reviews.facebook.net/D51777
Without any comments, this kind of slipped off my radar. I am going to rebase the patch on master and submit it for QA.

-1 overall

The checkstyle errors are related to method length which was already larger than the threshold. hadoopcheck is supposed to fail because the minimum hadoop version is now bumped to 2.7.1. TestMetricsRegion tests passed in the previous build. In short, none of the failures here are related to the patch.
